deathtouch.name: Deathtouch
deathtouch.description: Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.
deathtouch.example: Your 1/1 with deathtouch blocks their 10/10. Your creature deals 1 damage, but that's enough - their 10/10 dies.
deathtouch.tip: Combine with trample: you only need to assign 1 damage to each blocker, the rest tramples through.

defender.name: Defender
defender.example: Your 0/5 Wall with defender can block any attacker, but you can't declare it as an attacker.
defender.tip: Defenders often have high toughness for their mana cost, making them efficient blockers.

double strike.name: Double Strike
double strike.description: This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.
double strike.example: Your 3/3 with double strike attacks unblocked. It deals 3 first-strike damage, then 3 regular damage - 6 total.
double strike.tip: Power boosts are twice as effective. A +2/+0 buff gives +4 total damage.

enchant.name: Enchant
enchant.description: This Aura can only be attached to the specified type of permanent or player.
enchant.example: 'Enchant creature' means you choose a creature when casting - the Aura attaches to that creature.
enchant.tip: If the enchanted permanent leaves the battlefield, the Aura goes to the graveyard.

equip.name: Equip
equip.description: Pay the equip cost to attach this Equipment to a creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.
equip.example: You have a Sword with 'Equip 2'. Pay 2 mana during your main phase to attach it to your creature.
equip.tip: Unlike Auras, Equipment stays on the battlefield when the equipped creature dies.

first strike.name: First Strike
first strike.description: This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.
first strike.example: Your 2/2 first striker blocks their 3/2. Your creature deals 2 damage first, killing theirs before it can hit back.
first strike.tip: First strike lets smaller creatures win fights they'd normally trade in or lose.

flash.name: Flash
flash.description: You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.
flash.example: Your opponent attacks with a 3/3. You cast a 2/4 creature with flash and block their attacker.
flash.tip: Flash lets you keep mana open for instants, then play a creature if you don't need to respond.

flying.name: Flying
flying.description: This creature can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.
flying.example: Your 2/2 flier attacks. Your opponent has only ground creatures, so they can't block.
flying.tip: Flying is one of the most reliable forms of evasion for getting damage through.

haste.name: Haste
haste.description: This creature can attack and use tap abilities the turn it comes under your control.
haste.example: You cast a 4/4 with haste. Normally you'd wait a turn, but haste lets you attack immediately.
haste.tip: Haste creatures are great for surprise damage when opponents think they're safe.

hexproof.name: Hexproof
hexproof.description: This permanent cannot be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.
hexproof.example: Your opponent tries to cast 'Destroy target creature' on your hexproof creature - it's not a legal target.
hexproof.tip: Hexproof protects from targeted removal, but not effects that say 'all creatures' or 'each creature'.

indestructible.name: Indestructible
indestructible.description: Damage and effects that say 'destroy' do not destroy this permanent.
indestructible.example: Your indestructible creature blocks a 10/10. It takes 10 damage but doesn't die.
indestructible.tip: Indestructible doesn't protect against sacrifice, exile, or effects that reduce toughness to 0 or less.

intimidate.name: Intimidate
intimidate.description: This creature can only be blocked by artifact creatures and creatures that share a color with it.
intimidate.example: Your red creature with intimidate attacks. Only red creatures or artifact creatures can block it.
intimidate.tip: Intimidate is less effective in multicolor formats where opponents often share your colors.

landwalk.name: Landwalk
landwalk.description: This creature is unblockable as long as the defending player controls a land of the specified type.
landwalk.example: Your creature has Islandwalk. If your opponent controls an Island, they can't block this creature.
landwalk.tip: Landwalk is matchup-dependent but provides guaranteed evasion when it applies.

lifelink.name: Lifelink
lifelink.description: Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.
lifelink.example: Your 3/3 with lifelink attacks and deals 3 damage. You also gain 3 life.
lifelink.tip: Lifelink works on ALL damage this creature deals, including when blocking or from fight effects.

menace.name: Menace
menace.description: This creature cannot be blocked except by two or more creatures.
menace.example: Your menace creature attacks. Your opponent must block with 2+ creatures or not at all.
menace.tip: Menace is great when opponents have few creatures, forcing unfavorable multi-blocks.

protection.name: Protection
protection.description: This permanent cannot be damaged, enchanted, equipped, blocked, or targeted by sources of the specified quality.
protection.example: 'Protection from red' means red creatures can't block it, red spells can't target it, and red sources deal no damage to it.
protection.tip: Remember DEBT: can't be Damaged, Enchanted/Equipped, Blocked, or Targeted by the specified quality.

reach.name: Reach
reach.description: This creature can block creatures with flying.
reach.example: Your opponent attacks with a 2/2 flier. Your 1/4 with reach can block it even though it doesn't fly.
reach.tip: Reach provides defense against fliers without giving your creature flying's evasion.

shroud.name: Shroud
shroud.description: This permanent cannot be the target of spells or abilities.
shroud.example: You want to pump your shroud creature with Giant Growth, but you can't - shroud prevents all targeting, even yours.
shroud.tip: Shroud is symmetrical - protected from opponents but you can't enhance it with Auras or targeted buffs.

trample.name: Trample
trample.description: This creature can deal excess combat damage to the defending player or planeswalker.
trample.example: Your 7/7 trampler is blocked by a 2/2. Assign 2 damage to kill the blocker; 5 tramples through to the player.
trample.tip: Trample plus deathtouch is devastating - assign only 1 damage per blocker, the rest tramples through.

vigilance.name: Vigilance
vigilance.description: Attacking does not cause this creature to tap.
vigilance.example: Your 4/4 with vigilance attacks. It stays untapped, so it can also block on your opponent's turn.
vigilance.tip: Vigilance excels on large creatures that can pressure opponents while still defending.

ward.name: Ward
ward.description: Whenever this permanent becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter it unless that player pays the ward cost.
ward.example: Your creature has 'Ward 2'. If your opponent tries to target it, they must pay 2 extra mana or the spell is countered.
ward.tip: Ward doesn't prevent targeting - it taxes it. Opponents with excess mana can still pay the cost.

banding.name: Banding
banding.description: Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.
banding.example: Your three creatures with banding attack as a band. If blocked, YOU decide how the blocker's damage is distributed.
banding.tip: Banding's main benefit: you control damage assignment when your banding creatures are in combat.

rampage.name: Rampage
rampage.description: Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +N/+N until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.
rampage.example: Your Rampage 2 creature is blocked by three creatures. It gets +4/+4 (2 creatures beyond the first, times 2).
rampage.tip: Rampage discourages gang-blocking, making your creature harder to kill in combat.

cumulative upkeep.name: Cumulative Upkeep
cumulative upkeep.description: At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.
cumulative upkeep.example: Your permanent has 'Cumulative upkeep 1'. Turn 2: pay 1. Turn 3: pay 2. Turn 4: pay 3. It escalates.
cumulative upkeep.tip: Plan when to sacrifice - the escalating cost eventually becomes unsustainable.

flanking.name: Flanking
flanking.description: Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
flanking.example: Your flanking creature is blocked by a 2/2 without flanking. The blocker becomes 1/1 before damage.
flanking.tip: Multiple instances of flanking stack, giving -1/-1 for each.

phasing.name: Phasing
phasing.description: This permanent phases in and out at the beginning of your untap step. While phased out, it is treated as if it does not exist.
phasing.example: Your phasing creature phases out. Next turn it phases back in, untapped and ready to act.
phasing.tip: Phasing doesn't trigger enter/leave effects - the permanent is just temporarily 'gone'.

buyback.name: Buyback
buyback.description: You may pay the buyback cost in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.
buyback.example: Cast a spell with 'Buyback 3'. Pay 3 extra mana and it returns to your hand instead of going to the graveyard.
buyback.tip: Buyback provides repeatable effects at the cost of mana efficiency.

shadow.name: Shadow
shadow.description: This creature can only block or be blocked by creatures with shadow.
shadow.example: Your shadow creature attacks. Unless your opponent has shadow creatures, they can't block it.
shadow.tip: Shadow creatures are nearly unblockable but also can't block normal attackers - plan defense accordingly.

cycling.name: Cycling
cycling.description: Pay the cycling cost and discard this card to draw a card.
cycling.example: You have a situational card you don't need. Pay its cycling cost, discard it, draw a new card.
cycling.tip: Cycling adds flexibility - the card is never dead since you can trade it for something else.

echo.name: Echo
echo.description: At the beginning of your upkeep, if this permanent came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.
echo.example: You cast an echo creature. Next upkeep, pay its echo cost again or sacrifice it.
echo.tip: Echo creatures offer powerful effects but require double investment over two turns.

horsemanship.name: Horsemanship
horsemanship.description: This creature can only be blocked by creatures with horsemanship.
horsemanship.example: Your horsemanship creature attacks. Only other creatures with horsemanship can block it.
horsemanship.tip: Horsemanship is like flying but rarer - few creatures have it, making it excellent evasion.

fading.name: Fading
fading.description: This permanent enters with fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter. If you cannot, sacrifice this permanent.
fading.example: Your creature enters with 'Fading 3' (3 fade counters). It lasts 3 upkeeps before being sacrificed.
fading.tip: Fading permanents are often undercosted for their power level due to their limited lifespan.

kicker.name: Kicker
kicker.description: You may pay an additional kicker cost as you cast this spell for an enhanced effect.
kicker.example: A spell costs 2 with 'Kicker 3'. Pay just 2 for the base effect, or 5 total for an enhanced version.
kicker.tip: Kicker cards scale well - useful early game at base cost, powerful late game when kicked.

flashback.name: Flashback
flashback.description: You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.
flashback.example: Your instant is in the graveyard. Pay its flashback cost to cast it again, then it exiles.
flashback.tip: Flashback effectively gives you two spells in one card - excellent value in longer games.

madness.name: Madness
madness.description: If you discard this card, you may cast it for its madness cost instead of putting it into your graveyard.
madness.example: You discard a madness card to another effect. Instead of it going to the graveyard, cast it for its madness cost.
madness.tip: Pair with discard outlets to turn a drawback into casting spells at a discount.

fear.name: Fear
fear.description: This creature can only be blocked by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.
fear.example: Your fear creature attacks. Only artifact creatures or black creatures can block it.
fear.tip: Fear is the predecessor to intimidate - effective against non-black decks.

morph.name: Morph
morph.description: You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for 3 mana. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.
morph.example: Cast your creature face-down as a 2/2 for 3. Later, pay its morph cost to flip it face-up with its real stats and abilities.
morph.tip: Morph creates mind games - opponents don't know what's face-down until you flip it.

amplify.name: Amplify
amplify.description: As this creature enters, reveal any number of cards from your hand that share a creature type with it. This creature enters with +1/+1 counters equal to the amplify value times the number of cards revealed.
amplify.example: Your Amplify 2 Dragon enters. Reveal 3 Dragons from hand - it enters with 6 +1/+1 counters.
amplify.tip: Build tribal decks to maximize amplify payoffs.

provoke.name: Provoke
provoke.description: Whenever this creature attacks, you may have target creature defending player controls untap and block it if able.
provoke.example: Attack with your provoke creature and force their best blocker to block it, even if it was tapped.
provoke.tip: Use provoke to pick off utility creatures or force unfavorable blocks.

storm.name: Storm
storm.description: When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.
storm.example: You cast 5 spells, then cast a storm spell. You get the original plus 5 copies - 6 total.
storm.tip: Storm is extremely powerful. Build decks with cheap spells to maximize the storm count.

affinity.name: Affinity
affinity.description: This spell costs 1 less to cast for each permanent of the specified type you control.
affinity.example: Your 'Affinity for artifacts' spell costs 6. You control 4 artifacts, so it costs only 2.
affinity.tip: Affinity can reduce costs to zero with enough permanents of the right type.

entwine.name: Entwine
entwine.description: Pay the entwine cost to choose all modes of this spell instead of just one.
entwine.example: A modal spell says 'Choose one.' Pay its entwine cost to choose all modes instead.
entwine.tip: Entwine turns flexible spells into powerful combined effects.

modular.name: Modular
modular.description: This creature enters with +1/+1 counters on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.
modular.example: Your Modular 3 creature dies with 5 counters. Move all 5 to another artifact creature.
modular.tip: Modular counters persist across deaths - great for building up a single threat.

sunburst.name: Sunburst
sunburst.description: This permanent enters with a counter for each color of mana spent to cast it.
sunburst.example: Cast a sunburst artifact using white, blue, and green mana. It enters with 3 counters.
sunburst.tip: Five-color mana bases maximize sunburst payoffs.

bushido.name: Bushido
bushido.description: Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +N/+N until end of turn.
bushido.example: Your Bushido 2 creature blocks. It gets +2/+2 until end of turn during that combat.
bushido.tip: Bushido makes creatures better in combat but doesn't help them get through unblocked.

soulshift.name: Soulshift
soulshift.description: When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with mana value N or less from your graveyard to your hand.
soulshift.example: Your Soulshift 4 creature dies. Return a Spirit with mana value 4 or less from your graveyard to hand.
soulshift.tip: Chain soulshift creatures to maintain card advantage in Spirit tribal decks.

splice.name: Splice
splice.description: As you cast a spell of the specified type, you may reveal this card and pay its splice cost to copy its text onto that spell.
splice.example: Cast an Arcane spell. Reveal a card with 'Splice onto Arcane' and pay its cost to add that card's effect.
splice.tip: Splicing doesn't use the card - you keep it in hand to splice again and again.

offering.name: Offering
offering.description: You may cast this card any time you could cast an instant by sacrificing a creature of the specified type and paying the difference in mana costs.
offering.example: Your 'Goblin offering' creature costs 5. Sacrifice a 2-mana Goblin, pay 3, cast at instant speed.
offering.tip: Offering provides flash and a mana discount for tribal synergies.

ninjutsu.name: Ninjutsu
ninjutsu.description: Pay the ninjutsu cost and return an unblocked attacking creature you control to its owner's hand to put this card onto the battlefield tapped and attacking.
ninjutsu.example: Your 1/1 is unblocked. Pay ninjutsu cost, return it to hand, put your Ninja onto the battlefield attacking.
ninjutsu.tip: Ninjutsu reuses enter-the-battlefield effects and surprises opponents with larger attackers.

epic.name: Epic
epic.description: For the rest of the game, you cannot cast spells. At the beginning of each of your upkeeps, copy this spell.
epic.example: Cast an epic spell. You can't cast any more spells this game, but you copy this spell every upkeep.
epic.tip: Epic is all-in - make sure the repeated effect is worth giving up all other spells.

convoke.name: Convoke
convoke.description: Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for 1 or one mana of that creature's color.
convoke.example: Your spell costs 5W. Tap 3 white creatures and pay 2W, or tap 5 creatures and pay just W.
convoke.tip: Convoke works best with token strategies that generate many creatures.

dredge.name: Dredge
dredge.description: If you would draw a card, you may mill cards equal to this card's dredge number and return this card from your graveyard to your hand instead.
dredge.example: You would draw a card. Instead, mill 5 cards and return your Dredge 5 card from graveyard to hand.
dredge.tip: Dredge fills your graveyard rapidly - combine with graveyard synergies.

transmute.name: Transmute
transmute.description: Pay the transmute cost and discard this card to search your library for a card with the same mana value, reveal it, and put it into your hand.
transmute.example: Your 3-mana card has transmute. Pay the cost, discard it, search for any other 3-mana card.
transmute.tip: Transmute acts as a tutor for specific mana values - build around key costs.

bloodthirst.name: Bloodthirst
bloodthirst.description: If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters with +1/+1 counters on it.
bloodthirst.example: Deal any damage to an opponent, then cast your Bloodthirst 2 creature. It enters with 2 +1/+1 counters.
bloodthirst.tip: Cheap creatures and burn spells enable bloodthirst before casting your main threat.

haunt.name: Haunt
haunt.description: When this card is put into a graveyard from the battlefield or when it resolves, exile it haunting target creature. When that creature dies, you may use this card's ability again.
haunt.example: Your haunt creature dies and haunts an opponent's creature. When that creature dies, trigger the ability again.
haunt.tip: Haunt provides two uses of an ability - once when cast/dying, once when the haunted creature dies.

replicate.name: Replicate
replicate.description: When you cast this spell, you may pay its replicate cost any number of times. Copy it that many times.
replicate.example: Cast a replicate spell and pay its replicate cost 3 times. You get the original plus 3 copies.
replicate.tip: Replicate scales with available mana - save it for late game when you can copy multiple times.

forecast.name: Forecast
forecast.description: During your upkeep, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its forecast cost to activate its forecast ability.
forecast.example: During upkeep, reveal this from hand and pay 2 to gain 2 life. The card stays in your hand.
forecast.tip: Forecast provides repeatable effects while keeping the card available to cast later.

graft.name: Graft
graft.description: This creature enters with +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature to it.
graft.example: Your Graft 3 creature is in play. A new creature enters - move one +1/+1 counter to it if you want.
graft.tip: Graft distributes counters to new creatures, enabling various +1/+1 counter synergies.

recover.name: Recover
recover.description: When a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay this card's recover cost to return it from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, exile it.
recover.example: A creature you control dies. Pay the recover cost on a card in your graveyard to return it to hand, or it exiles.
recover.tip: Recover triggers when any of your creatures die - use sacrifice outlets to control timing.

ripple.name: Ripple
ripple.description: When you cast this spell, reveal the top cards of your library equal to the ripple number. You may cast any cards with the same name without paying their mana costs.
ripple.example: Cast a Ripple 4 spell. Reveal top 4 cards - if any share this card's name, cast them free.
ripple.tip: Ripple rewards running multiple copies of the same card - ideally 4 in constructed.

split second.name: Split Second
split second.description: As long as this spell is on the stack, players cannot cast spells or activate abilities that are not mana abilities.
split second.example: Cast a split second spell. Opponents cannot respond with instants or activated abilities.
split second.tip: Split second prevents most responses but doesn't stop triggered abilities or mana abilities.

suspend.name: Suspend
suspend.description: Rather than cast this card from your hand, pay its suspend cost and exile it with time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.
suspend.example: Suspend a spell with 3 time counters. Three upkeeps later, it casts for free.
suspend.tip: Suspend trades tempo for mana efficiency - plan around the delayed casting.

vanishing.name: Vanishing
vanishing.description: This permanent enters with time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, sacrifice it.
vanishing.example: Your Vanishing 3 permanent enters with 3 time counters. It lasts 3 upkeeps before being sacrificed.
vanishing.tip: Vanishing creates a countdown - extract maximum value before time runs out.

absorb.name: Absorb
absorb.description: If a source would deal damage to this creature, prevent N of that damage.
absorb.example: Your Absorb 2 creature is dealt 5 damage. 2 is prevented; it only takes 3 damage.
absorb.tip: Absorb stacks with multiple instances, reducing damage from each source.

aura swap.name: Aura Swap
aura swap.description: Pay the aura swap cost to exchange this Aura with an Aura card in your hand.
aura swap.example: Your cheap Aura is attached to a creature. Pay aura swap to swap it for a powerful Aura from your hand.
aura swap.tip: Aura swap lets you deploy expensive Auras cheaply by upgrading from a smaller one.

delve.name: Delve
delve.description: Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for 1.
delve.example: Your spell costs 7. Exile 5 cards from your graveyard - now it only costs 2 mana.
delve.tip: Fill your graveyard quickly with cantrips and fetch lands to enable cheap delve spells.

fortify.name: Fortify
fortify.description: Pay the fortify cost to attach this Fortification to a land you control. Fortify only as a sorcery.
fortify.example: Pay the fortify cost to attach this Fortification to one of your lands, giving it bonuses.
fortify.tip: Fortifications work like Equipment but for lands instead of creatures.

frenzy.name: Frenzy
frenzy.description: Whenever this creature attacks and is not blocked, it gets +N/+0 until end of turn.
frenzy.example: Your Frenzy 2 creature attacks and isn't blocked. It gets +2/+0 for this combat.
frenzy.tip: Frenzy rewards getting through unblocked - pair with evasion abilities.

gravestorm.name: Gravestorm
gravestorm.description: When you cast this spell, copy it for each permanent put into a graveyard this turn.
gravestorm.example: Three permanents went to graveyards this turn. Cast your gravestorm spell - get 3 copies plus the original.
gravestorm.tip: Sacrifice effects and board wipes dramatically increase gravestorm count.

poisonous.name: Poisonous
poisonous.description: Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, that player gets poison counters.
poisonous.example: Your Poisonous 2 creature hits a player. They get 2 poison counters (10 poison = they lose).
poisonous.tip: Poisonous gives a fixed number of counters regardless of damage dealt.

transfigure.name: Transfigure
transfigure.description: Pay the transfigure cost and sacrifice this creature to search your library for a creature card with the same mana value, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
transfigure.example: Sacrifice your 3-mana creature with transfigure. Search for any 3-mana creature and put it onto the battlefield.
transfigure.tip: Transfigure is a tutor that upgrades your creature into exactly what you need.

champion.name: Champion
champion.description: When this creature enters, sacrifice it unless you exile another creature you control of the specified type. When this creature leaves, return the exiled card to the battlefield.
champion.example: Your 'Champion an Elf' creature enters. Exile an Elf you control. If this creature leaves, that Elf returns.
champion.tip: Champion temporarily removes your creature but protects it from most removal.

changeling.name: Changeling
changeling.description: This card is every creature type.
changeling.example: Your changeling creature counts as a Goblin, Elf, Dragon, Zombie - every creature type at once.
changeling.tip: Changelings work with any tribal synergy, making them highly versatile.

evoke.name: Evoke
evoke.description: You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, sacrifice it when it enters the battlefield.
evoke.example: Cast your creature for its evoke cost. Its enter-the-battlefield ability triggers, then you sacrifice it.
evoke.tip: Evoke turns creatures into one-shot spells - great when you just need the ETB effect.

hideaway.name: Hideaway
hideaway.description: This permanent enters tapped. When it does, look at the top cards of your library, exile one face down, then put the rest on the bottom.
hideaway.example: Your hideaway land enters tapped. Look at top 4 cards, hide one face-down, bottom the rest.
hideaway.tip: Hideaway cards have conditions to cast the hidden card for free - build around them.

prowl.name: Prowl
prowl.description: You may cast this for its prowl cost if you dealt combat damage to a player this turn with a creature that shares a creature type with this spell.
prowl.example: Your Rogue dealt combat damage. Now cast your Rogue spell for its cheaper prowl cost.
prowl.tip: Prowl rewards aggressive tribal strategies with discounted spells.

reinforce.name: Reinforce
reinforce.description: Pay the reinforce cost and discard this card to put +1/+1 counters on target creature.
reinforce.example: Discard your Reinforce 2 card and pay the cost. Put 2 +1/+1 counters on a creature.
reinforce.tip: Reinforce makes creature cards useful even when you'd rather have a combat trick.

conspire.name: Conspire
conspire.description: As you cast this spell, you may tap two untapped creatures you control that share a color with it. When you do, copy it.
conspire.example: Cast a red spell with conspire. Tap two red creatures to copy the spell.
conspire.tip: Conspire doubles spell effects at the cost of tapping creatures.

persist.name: Persist
persist.description: When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield with a -1/-1 counter on it.
persist.example: Your 3/3 persist creature dies. It returns as a 2/2 with a -1/-1 counter. Die again? Stays dead.
persist.tip: Remove the -1/-1 counter (with +1/+1 counters or other effects) for infinite death triggers.

wither.name: Wither
wither.description: This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.
wither.example: Your 2/2 wither creature deals 2 damage to a 3/3. It gets two -1/-1 counters, becoming a 1/1.
wither.tip: Wither damage is permanent - the creature stays smaller even after combat.

retrace.name: Retrace
retrace.description: You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.
retrace.example: Your retrace spell is in the graveyard. Discard a land and pay its cost to cast it again.
retrace.tip: Retrace turns excess lands into repeated spell casts - great in long games.

devour.name: Devour
devour.description: As this creature enters, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters with +1/+1 counters equal to the devour value times the number of creatures sacrificed.
devour.example: Your Devour 2 creature enters. Sacrifice 3 creatures - it enters with 6 +1/+1 counters.
devour.tip: Token generators provide fodder for devour without losing real cards.

exalted.name: Exalted
exalted.description: Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
exalted.example: You have 3 creatures with exalted. Attack with just one creature - it gets +3/+3.
exalted.tip: Exalted stacks across all your permanents with exalted, not just creatures.

unearth.name: Unearth
unearth.description: Pay the unearth cost to return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield.
unearth.example: Your creature is in the graveyard. Pay unearth - it returns with haste for one last attack, then exiles.
unearth.tip: Unearth provides one final use of a creature - maximize enter-the-battlefield or attack triggers.

cascade.name: Cascade
cascade.description: When you cast this spell, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card that costs less. You may cast it without paying its mana cost. Put the exiled cards on the bottom in a random order.
cascade.example: Cast a 5-mana cascade spell. Flip until you hit a 4-or-less mana nonland spell - cast it free.
cascade.tip: Build your deck so cascade always hits what you want - control the mana curve carefully.

annihilator.name: Annihilator
annihilator.description: Whenever this creature attacks, defending player sacrifices permanents equal to the annihilator value.
annihilator.example: Your Annihilator 4 creature attacks. Before blockers, your opponent sacrifices 4 permanents.
annihilator.tip: Annihilator triggers on attack declaration - even if blocked, the sacrifice happens.

level up.name: Level Up
level up.description: Pay the level up cost to put a level counter on this creature. Level up only as a sorcery.
level up.example: Pay the level up cost multiple times to add level counters. At certain levels, the creature gains new abilities and stats.
level up.tip: Level up is mana-intensive but creates a creature that scales throughout the game.

rebound.name: Rebound
rebound.description: If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast it from exile without paying its mana cost.
rebound.example: Cast a rebound spell. It exiles, then you cast it again for free next upkeep.
rebound.tip: Rebound gives you two casts for one card - excellent value on powerful effects.

totem armor.name: Totem Armor
totem armor.description: If enchanted creature would be destroyed, instead remove all damage from it and destroy this Aura.
totem armor.example: Your aura-enchanted creature would die. Instead, the totem armor Aura is destroyed and the creature lives.
totem armor.tip: Totem armor protects against destroy effects and lethal damage, but not exile or sacrifice.

infect.name: Infect
infect.description: This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.
infect.example: Your 2/2 infect hits a player - 2 poison counters. At 10 poison, they lose regardless of life total.
infect.tip: Infect ignores life totals and permanently shrinks creatures - a completely different damage axis.

battle cry.name: Battle Cry
battle cry.description: Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
battle cry.example: Attack with your battle cry creature and 3 others. The other 3 each get +1/+0.
battle cry.tip: Battle cry stacks - multiple battle cry attackers boost each other.

living weapon.name: Living Weapon
living weapon.description: When this Equipment enters, create a 0/0 black Phyrexian Germ creature token, then attach this to it.
living weapon.example: Cast living weapon Equipment. A 0/0 Germ token is created and equipped - it survives due to the Equipment's stats.
living weapon.tip: Living weapon creates an immediate creature, then the Equipment can be moved to better creatures later.

undying.name: Undying
undying.description: When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.
undying.example: Your 2/2 undying creature dies. It returns as a 3/3 with a +1/+1 counter. If it dies again with that counter, it stays dead.
undying.tip: Sacrifice outlets with undying creatures provide repeated value. Remove the counter for infinite loops.

miracle.name: Miracle
miracle.description: You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.
miracle.example: Draw this as your first card of the turn. Reveal it immediately and cast it for its miracle cost.
miracle.tip: Miracle rewards deck manipulation - set up your draws with scry or similar effects.

soulbond.name: Soulbond
soulbond.description: You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.
soulbond.example: Your soulbond creature enters. Pair it with another creature - both gain the soulbond ability.
soulbond.tip: Soulbond pairs can be broken by flickering or losing control of either creature.

overload.name: Overload
overload.description: You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of 'target' with 'each'.
overload.example: A spell says 'Destroy target artifact.' Pay overload - it becomes 'Destroy each artifact.'
overload.tip: Overload turns targeted removal into board wipes at a higher mana cost.

scavenge.name: Scavenge
scavenge.description: Exile this card from your graveyard and pay its scavenge cost to put +1/+1 counters equal to this creature's power on target creature.
scavenge.example: Your 4/4 is in the graveyard. Pay scavenge, exile it, put 4 +1/+1 counters on a creature.
scavenge.tip: Scavenge provides value from the graveyard - the bigger the creature, the more counters.

unleash.name: Unleash
unleash.description: You may have this creature enter with a +1/+1 counter on it. It cannot block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.
unleash.example: Your unleash creature enters. Choose: enter normally, or enter with +1/+1 but can't block.
unleash.tip: Unleash is best in aggressive decks that don't plan to block anyway.

cipher.name: Cipher
cipher.description: You may exile this spell card encoded on a creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player, its controller may cast a copy of the encoded card without paying its mana cost.
cipher.example: Cast a cipher spell, encode it on your creature. Each time that creature hits a player, cast the spell again free.
cipher.tip: Encode cipher spells on evasive creatures for repeated free casts.

evolve.name: Evolve
evolve.description: Whenever a creature enters under your control, if that creature has greater power or toughness than this creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.
evolve.example: Your 1/1 evolve creature is out. Play a 2/2 - evolve triggers because 2 > 1, putting a counter on the evolve creature.
evolve.tip: Evolve creatures grow as you play larger creatures - sequence your plays to maximize triggers.

extort.name: Extort
extort.description: Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay W/B. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.
extort.example: Cast any spell, pay 1 white or black mana, drain 1 life from each opponent.
extort.tip: Extort stacks - multiple extort permanents let you pay multiple times per spell.

fuse.name: Fuse
fuse.description: You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.
fuse.example: A split card has two halves. With fuse, cast both halves together as one combined spell.
fuse.tip: Fused spells have combined mana costs - useful for effects that care about mana value.

bestow.name: Bestow
bestow.description: If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.
bestow.example: Cast for bestow cost as an Aura on a creature. If that creature dies, this becomes a creature instead of going to the graveyard.
bestow.tip: Bestow provides resilience - you get a creature even if the enchanted creature is removed.

tribute.name: Tribute
tribute.description: As this creature enters, an opponent of your choice may put +1/+1 counters on it. If they don't, an ability triggers.
tribute.example: Your Tribute 3 creature enters. Opponent chooses: let it have +3/+3, or face its triggered ability.
tribute.tip: Both tribute options should be good for you - put your opponent in a lose-lose situation.

inspired.name: Inspired
inspired.description: Whenever this creature becomes untapped, an ability triggers.
inspired.example: Your inspired creature untaps during your untap step. Its ability triggers.
inspired.tip: Tap your inspired creatures with other effects to trigger inspired more often.

constellation.name: Constellation
constellation.description: Whenever an enchantment enters under your control, an ability triggers.
constellation.example: You cast an enchantment. All your constellation permanents trigger their abilities.
constellation.tip: Build enchantment-heavy decks to maximize constellation triggers.

outlast.name: Outlast
outlast.description: Pay the outlast cost and tap this creature to put a +1/+1 counter on it. Outlast only as a sorcery.
outlast.example: During your main phase, pay the outlast cost and tap your creature to add a +1/+1 counter.
outlast.tip: Outlast is slow but steady - best when you have nothing better to do with mana.

prowess.name: Prowess
prowess.description: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
prowess.example: Cast 3 instants in one turn. Your prowess creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
prowess.tip: Cheap cantrips (spells that draw cards) maximize prowess by chaining multiple triggers.

dash.name: Dash
dash.description: You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and is returned to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.
dash.example: Cast for dash cost. The creature has haste, attacks, then bounces to your hand at end of turn.
dash.tip: Dash provides repeated enter-the-battlefield triggers and dodges sorcery-speed removal.

exploit.name: Exploit
exploit.description: When this creature enters, you may sacrifice a creature.
exploit.example: Your exploit creature enters. You may sacrifice any creature (including itself) to trigger death synergies.
exploit.tip: Exploit can sacrifice itself or tokens for value - it's optional, so always beneficial.

megamorph.name: Megamorph
megamorph.description: You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for 3 mana. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.
megamorph.example: Cast face-down as a 2/2. Later, pay megamorph cost to flip it and add a +1/+1 counter.
megamorph.tip: Megamorph is morph with a bonus counter - same mind games, slightly bigger payoff.

renown.name: Renown
renown.description: When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes renowned.
renown.example: Your Renown 2 creature hits a player. It gets 2 +1/+1 counters and becomes renowned (only once).
renown.tip: Renown triggers once ever - prioritize getting the first hit through for permanent stats.

awaken.name: Awaken
awaken.description: If you cast this spell for its awaken cost, also put +1/+1 counters on target land you control and it becomes a 0/0 Elemental creature with haste. It's still a land.
awaken.example: Pay awaken cost on an instant. The spell happens AND a land becomes a creature with counters.
awaken.tip: Awakened lands are vulnerable to creature removal - the counters stay if it stops being a creature.

devoid.name: Devoid
devoid.example: A devoid card might cost blue mana but is colorless - it can't be countered by 'counter target blue spell.'
devoid.tip: Devoid cards benefit from colorless synergies while being cast with colored mana.

ingest.name: Ingest
ingest.description: Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, that player exiles the top card of their library.
ingest.example: Your ingest creature hits a player. They exile the top card of their library face-up.
ingest.tip: Ingest fuels processors that use opponents' exiled cards - part of the Eldrazi strategy.

rally.name: Rally
rally.description: Whenever a creature enters under your control, an ability triggers.
rally.example: Play a creature. Your rally permanents each trigger their abilities.
rally.tip: Maximize rally with token generation and flicker effects.

surge.name: Surge
surge.description: You may cast this spell for its surge cost if you or a teammate has cast another spell this turn.
surge.example: Your teammate cast a spell. Now cast your surge spell at its cheaper surge cost.
surge.tip: In multiplayer, surge becomes easier to enable with teammates' help.

skulk.name: Skulk
skulk.description: This creature cannot be blocked by creatures with greater power.
skulk.example: Your 2/1 skulk creature attacks. Enemy 3/3s and 4/4s can't block it - only 2-power or less creatures can.
skulk.tip: Skulk is better on small creatures - they slip past big blockers.

emerge.name: Emerge
emerge.description: You may cast this spell by sacrificing a creature and paying the emerge cost reduced by that creature's mana value.
emerge.example: Your Emerge 7 creature: sacrifice a 4-mana creature, pay only 3 mana to cast it.
emerge.tip: Sacrifice creatures with good death triggers or enter-the-battlefield effects already used.

escalate.name: Escalate
escalate.description: Pay the escalate cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.
escalate.example: A modal spell with Escalate 1: choose 2 modes for +1 mana, or 3 modes for +2 mana total.
escalate.tip: Escalate provides flexibility - choose modes based on the situation and available mana.

meld.name: Meld
meld.description: If you control both members of a meld pair, exile them, then meld them into a single oversized card.
meld.example: You control both meld pair cards. They exile and combine into one powerful oversized creature.
meld.tip: Meld requires both specific cards - build decks to find and protect both pieces.

crew.name: Crew
crew.description: Tap any number of creatures you control with total power N or more to turn this Vehicle into an artifact creature until end of turn.
crew.example: Your Vehicle has Crew 3. Tap creatures totaling 3+ power to make it a creature this turn.
crew.tip: Creatures with summoning sickness can still crew Vehicles.

fabricate.name: Fabricate
fabricate.description: When this creature enters, put +1/+1 counters on it, or create that many 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature tokens.
fabricate.example: Your Fabricate 2 creature enters. Choose: +2/+2 on it, OR create 2 Servo tokens.
fabricate.tip: Choose tokens for go-wide strategies; choose counters for a single large threat.

partner.name: Partner
partner.description: You can have two commanders if both have partner.
partner.example: Choose two partner commanders for your deck. You have access to both commanders' colors.
partner.tip: Partner expands color combinations and provides backup if one commander is removed.

undaunted.name: Undaunted
undaunted.description: This spell costs 1 less to cast for each opponent.
undaunted.example: In a 4-player game with 3 opponents, your Undaunted spell costs 3 less.
undaunted.tip: Undaunted scales with opponent count - best in multiplayer formats.

improvise.name: Improvise
improvise.description: Each artifact you tap while casting this spell pays for 1.
improvise.example: Your spell costs 5. Tap 3 artifacts - now pay only 2 mana.
improvise.tip: Improvise works with any artifacts, including Equipment and tokens.

revolt.name: Revolt
revolt.description: An ability that checks if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn.
revolt.example: A creature you controlled died this turn. Your revolt spell gets its bonus effect.
revolt.tip: Enable revolt with fetch lands, sacrifice effects, or flicker abilities.

aftermath.name: Aftermath
aftermath.description: Cast this spell only from your graveyard. Then exile it.
aftermath.example: The aftermath half of a split card can only be cast from your graveyard, then it exiles.
aftermath.tip: Cast the first half normally, then the aftermath half later from graveyard.

embalm.name: Embalm
embalm.description: Pay the embalm cost and exile this card from your graveyard to create a token copy of it, except it's a white Zombie with no mana cost.
embalm.example: Your creature is in the graveyard. Pay embalm - exile it and create a white Zombie token copy.
embalm.tip: Embalm provides a second use for creatures - the token has the same abilities.

eternalize.name: Eternalize
eternalize.description: Pay the eternalize cost and exile this card from your graveyard to create a token copy of it, except it's a 4/4 black Zombie.
eternalize.example: Exile your creature from graveyard. Create a 4/4 black Zombie token copy with its abilities.
eternalize.tip: Eternalize always makes a 4/4 regardless of original stats - abilities are what matter.

afflict.name: Afflict
afflict.description: Whenever this creature becomes blocked, defending player loses life equal to the afflict value.
afflict.example: Your Afflict 3 creature is blocked. The blocking player loses 3 life regardless of combat outcome.
afflict.tip: Afflict punishes blocking - opponents take damage whether they block or not.

ascend.name: Ascend
ascend.description: If you control ten or more permanents, you get the city's blessing for the rest of the game.
ascend.example: You control 10 permanents. You have the city's blessing permanently, enabling bonus effects.
ascend.tip: The city's blessing is permanent once earned - it doesn't go away if permanents are lost.

assist.name: Assist
assist.description: Another player can pay up to the full cost of this spell.
assist.example: Your assist spell costs 6. An ally pays 4, you pay 2.
assist.tip: Assist is a political tool in multiplayer - negotiate help from allies.

jump-start.name: Jump-Start
jump-start.description: You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a card in addition to paying its other costs. Then exile it.
jump-start.example: Your instant is in the graveyard. Discard a card, pay its cost, cast it again, then exile it.
jump-start.tip: Jump-start turns dead cards in hand into fuel for graveyard spells.

mentor.name: Mentor
mentor.description: Whenever this creature attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on target attacking creature with lesser power.
mentor.example: Your 3/3 mentor and 2/2 attack together. The 3/3 mentors the 2/2, putting a +1/+1 counter on it.
mentor.tip: Mentor permanently grows smaller creatures - repeated attacks build an army.

surveil.name: Surveil
surveil.description: Look at the top cards of your library, then put any number of them into your graveyard and the rest back on top in any order.
surveil.example: Surveil 2: look at top 2 cards, put any in graveyard, keep the rest on top in any order.
surveil.tip: Surveil is like scry but better for graveyard strategies - fuel flashback, escape, etc.

undergrowth.name: Undergrowth
undergrowth.description: An ability that counts or cares about creature cards in your graveyard.
undergrowth.example: Your undergrowth spell checks creatures in your graveyard. 5 creature cards = more powerful effect.
undergrowth.tip: Self-mill and sacrifice fuel undergrowth counts.

afterlife.name: Afterlife
afterlife.description: When this creature dies, create 1/1 white and black Spirit creature tokens with flying.
afterlife.example: Your Afterlife 2 creature dies. Create 2 Spirit tokens with flying.
afterlife.tip: Afterlife provides death insurance - you keep a board presence even when creatures die.

riot.name: Riot
riot.description: This creature enters with your choice of a +1/+1 counter or haste.
riot.example: Your riot creature enters. Choose: bigger stats with a counter, or attack immediately with haste.
riot.tip: Choose haste when you need immediate impact; choose the counter for a bigger threat.

spectacle.name: Spectacle
spectacle.description: You may cast this spell for its spectacle cost if an opponent lost life this turn.
spectacle.example: You dealt damage to an opponent. Now cast your spell at its cheaper spectacle cost.
spectacle.tip: Any life loss enables spectacle - damage, life payment, or drain effects all count.

adapt.name: Adapt
adapt.description: If this creature has no +1/+1 counters on it, put +1/+1 counters on it.
adapt.example: Pay the Adapt 3 cost. If your creature has no +1/+1 counters, it gets 3.
adapt.tip: Adapt only works once unless you remove the counters somehow.

addendum.name: Addendum
addendum.description: If you cast this spell during your main phase, you get an additional effect.
addendum.example: Cast at instant speed normally, or during main phase for a bonus addendum effect.
addendum.tip: Addendum rewards patience - cast during main phase when you can afford to.

amass.name: Amass
amass.description: Put +1/+1 counters on an Army you control. If you don't control one, create a 0/0 black Zombie Army creature token first.
amass.example: Amass 3: if you have no Army, create a 0/0 Zombie Army, then put 3 +1/+1 counters on it.
amass.tip: Amass builds a single large Army creature over multiple spells.

proliferate.name: Proliferate
proliferate.description: Choose any number of permanents and/or players, then give each another counter of each kind already there.
proliferate.example: Your creature has 2 +1/+1 counters. Proliferate - now it has 3. An opponent has 1 poison - now 2.
proliferate.tip: Proliferate adds counters of every type - +1/+1, loyalty, poison, charge, etc.

adventure.name: Adventure
adventure.description: Cast this as an Adventure, then exile it. You may cast the creature later from exile.
adventure.example: Cast the Adventure spell half first. It exiles. Later, cast the creature from exile.
adventure.tip: Adventures provide two cards in one - instant/sorcery effect plus creature.

adamant.name: Adamant
adamant.description: If at least three mana of the same color was spent to cast this spell, you get an additional effect.
adamant.example: Your spell costs 2W. Pay WWW instead - adamant triggers for a bonus effect.
adamant.tip: Adamant rewards mono-color or heavily-weighted mana bases.

food.name: Food
food.description: Food is an artifact type. Food tokens typically have: '2, Tap, Sacrifice this: You gain 3 life.'
food.example: Sacrifice your Food token and pay 2 mana to gain 3 life.
food.tip: Food provides repeatable life gain and can be sacrificed for other effects.

escape.name: Escape
escape.description: You may cast this card from your graveyard for its escape cost.
escape.example: Your creature is in the graveyard. Pay its escape cost (usually mana plus exiling cards) to cast it again.
escape.tip: Escape is repeatable as long as you can pay the cost - great inevitability in long games.

mutate.name: Mutate
mutate.description: If you cast this spell for its mutate cost, put it over or under target non-Human creature you own. They mutate into the creature on top plus all abilities from under it.
mutate.example: Mutate onto your creature. Choose which is on top for stats - it has all abilities from both.
mutate.tip: Mutate stacks - pile multiple mutations for a single creature with many abilities.

companion.name: Companion
companion.description: If you've fulfilled this card's companion requirement during deckbuilding, you may pay 3 to put it from outside the game into your hand once during the game.
companion.example: Your deck meets the companion restriction. Pay 3 mana to put your companion into your hand.
companion.tip: Companions provide a guaranteed 8th card if you build your deck correctly.

boast.name: Boast
boast.description: Activate this ability only if this creature attacked this turn and only once each turn.
boast.example: Your creature attacked this turn. Now you can activate its boast ability once.
boast.tip: Boast rewards attacking - it doesn't require dealing damage, just declaring an attack.

foretell.name: Foretell
foretell.description: During your turn, you may pay 2 and exile this card from your hand face down. Cast it on a later turn for its foretell cost.
foretell.example: Pay 2, exile a card face-down. Later, cast it for its foretell cost (often cheaper).
foretell.tip: Foretell spreads mana cost across turns and creates uncertainty for opponents.

magecraft.name: Magecraft
magecraft.description: Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, an ability triggers.
magecraft.example: Cast an instant. Your magecraft creatures all trigger their abilities.
magecraft.tip: Copy effects trigger magecraft too - spell-copy decks maximize these triggers.

learn.name: Learn
learn.description: You may reveal a Lesson card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or discard a card to draw a card.
learn.example: When you learn, get a Lesson from your sideboard, OR discard and draw if you have no Lessons.
learn.tip: In formats with sideboards, keep Lessons there for flexible options.

daybound.name: Daybound
daybound.description: If a player casts no spells during their own turn, it becomes night next turn. This permanent transforms.
daybound.example: No one cast spells during your turn - it becomes night and daybound creatures transform.
daybound.tip: Daybound creates a mini-game of spell counting - plan around day/night shifts.

nightbound.name: Nightbound
nightbound.description: If a player casts at least two spells during their own turn, it becomes day next turn. This permanent transforms.
nightbound.example: Two spells were cast during a turn - it becomes day and nightbound creatures transform.
nightbound.tip: Control day/night by managing how many spells you cast per turn.

decayed.name: Decayed
decayed.description: This creature cannot block. When it attacks, sacrifice it at end of combat.
decayed.example: Your decayed zombie attacks. After combat damage, sacrifice it.
decayed.tip: Decayed creatures are disposable - use death triggers or sacrifice before end of combat.

disturb.name: Disturb
disturb.description: You may cast this card transformed from your graveyard for its disturb cost.
disturb.example: Your creature is in the graveyard. Pay disturb cost to cast its transformed (back) side.
disturb.tip: Disturb creatures have two lives - the front and back are often different card types.

cleave.name: Cleave
cleave.description: You may cast this spell for its cleave cost. If you do, remove the words in brackets.
cleave.example: 'Destroy target [creature with power 2 or less]' - pay cleave to destroy any creature.
cleave.tip: Cleave removes restrictions - the cleave version is usually more powerful.

training.name: Training
training.description: Whenever this creature attacks with another creature with greater power, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.
training.example: Your 2/2 training creature attacks alongside a 4/4. It gets a +1/+1 counter.
training.tip: Training creatures grow when attacking with bigger allies - sequence your creature plays.

casualty.name: Casualty
casualty.description: As you cast this spell, you may sacrifice a creature with power N or greater. When you do, copy this spell.
casualty.example: Cast a Casualty 2 spell. Sacrifice a 2+ power creature to copy the spell.
casualty.tip: Casualty turns creatures into spell copies - great with token generators.

connive.name: Connive
connive.description: Draw cards equal to the connive value, then discard that many cards. Put a +1/+1 counter on this creature for each nonland card discarded this way.
connive.example: Connive 2: draw 2, discard 2. For each nonland discarded, put a +1/+1 counter on the creature.
connive.tip: Connive filters your hand and grows your creature - discard nonlands for counters.

blitz.name: Blitz
blitz.description: If you cast this spell for its blitz cost, it gains haste and 'When this creature dies, draw a card.' Sacrifice it at end of turn.
blitz.example: Cast for blitz: creature has haste, attacks, draws a card when it dies, then sacrifices end of turn.
blitz.tip: Blitz is great for enter-the-battlefield and death triggers plus immediate pressure.

alliance.name: Alliance
alliance.description: Whenever another creature enters under your control, an ability triggers.
alliance.example: Play a creature. All your alliance permanents trigger their abilities.
alliance.tip: Token generation and flicker effects maximize alliance triggers.

shield counter.name: Shield Counter
shield counter.description: If this creature would be dealt damage or destroyed, remove a shield counter from it instead.
shield counter.example: Your creature with a shield counter would die. Remove the shield counter - it survives.
shield counter.tip: Shield counters prevent both damage and destroy effects - versatile protection.

read ahead.name: Read Ahead
read ahead.description: Choose a chapter and start with that many lore counters. Skip chapters before that chapter.
read ahead.example: A Saga has chapters I, II, III. Read ahead to chapter II - skip I, start at II.
read ahead.tip: Read ahead lets you skip to powerful later chapters immediately.

enlist.name: Enlist
enlist.description: As this creature attacks, you may tap a non-attacking creature you control without summoning sickness. When you do, add its power to this creature's until end of turn.
enlist.example: Attack with an enlist creature. Tap a 3/3 ally - the attacker gets +3/+0.
enlist.tip: Enlist lets non-attackers contribute power - use on creatures that can't attack safely.

domain.name: Domain
domain.description: An ability that counts or cares about the number of basic land types among lands you control.
domain.example: You control Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, Forest. Domain is 5 - maximum effect.
domain.tip: Triomes and other multi-type lands help reach higher domain counts.

prototype.name: Prototype
prototype.description: You may cast this spell with different mana cost, color, power, and toughness using the prototype values.
prototype.example: A 7/7 for 8 mana OR a 3/3 for 3 mana (prototype). Same abilities, different stats and cost.
prototype.tip: Prototype provides flexibility - cheap early version or expensive powerful version.

toxic.name: Toxic
toxic.description: Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, that player gets poison counters equal to the toxic value.
toxic.example: Your Toxic 2 creature hits a player. They get 2 poison counters (plus any damage dealt).
toxic.tip: Toxic is separate from damage - you deal both regular damage AND poison.

corrupted.name: Corrupted
corrupted.description: An ability that checks if an opponent has three or more poison counters.
corrupted.example: An opponent has 3 poison. Your corrupted effects are now active.
corrupted.tip: Corrupted turns on at 3 poison - pair with toxic creatures to enable it.

for mirrodin!.name: For Mirrodin!
for mirrodin!.description: When this Equipment enters, create a 2/2 red Rebel creature token, then attach this to it.
for mirrodin!.example: Cast this Equipment. A 2/2 Rebel token appears already equipped with it.
for mirrodin!.tip: For Mirrodin! provides an equipped creature immediately - the token carries the Equipment.

oil counter.name: Oil Counter
oil counter.description: A counter type used by various Phyrexian cards for different effects.
oil counter.example: Your permanent uses oil counters for its ability. Add or remove them as specified.
oil counter.tip: Oil counters work with proliferate - add more over time.

incubate.name: Incubate
incubate.description: Create an Incubator token with +1/+1 counters on it. It has '2: Transform this artifact.' It transforms into a 0/0 Phyrexian artifact creature.
incubate.example: Incubate 3: create an Incubator artifact with 3 +1/+1 counters. Pay 2 to make it a 3/3 creature.
incubate.tip: Incubators let you deploy creatures later - store them until you need threats.

backup.name: Backup
backup.description: When this creature enters, put +1/+1 counters on target creature. If that's another creature, it gains this creature's abilities until end of turn.
backup.example: Your Backup 2 creature enters. Put 2 counters on another creature - it also gains this creature's abilities until end of turn.
backup.tip: Backup can target itself for just counters, or another creature for counters plus abilities.

battles.name: Battles
battles.description: A card type that enters with defense counters and can be attacked. When defeated, it transforms.
battles.example: Your Siege battle enters under an opponent's protection. Attack it to remove defense counters - when defeated, it transforms.
battles.tip: Battles provide bonuses when you defeat them - coordinate attacks to destroy them.

craft.name: Craft
craft.description: Pay the craft cost and exile this permanent and other specified materials from among permanents you control and/or your graveyard. Return this card to the battlefield transformed.
craft.example: Exile this artifact and 4 other artifacts from battlefield/graveyard. It returns transformed.
craft.tip: Craft requires resources but the transformed side is typically powerful.

discover.name: Discover
discover.description: Exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card with mana value N or less. Cast it without paying its mana cost or put it into your hand.
discover.example: Discover 3: flip until you find a nonland with mana value 3 or less. Cast free or add to hand.
discover.tip: Discover gives choice unlike cascade - put in hand if the free spell isn't ideal now.

finality counter.name: Finality Counter
finality counter.description: If a creature with a finality counter on it would die, exile it instead.
finality counter.example: Your creature with a finality counter dies. It exiles instead of going to the graveyard.
finality counter.tip: Finality counters prevent graveyard strategies - use on threats you need gone permanently.

descend.name: Descend
descend.description: An ability that checks how many permanent cards are in your graveyard.
descend.example: You have 4 permanent cards in graveyard. 'Descend 4' abilities are active.
descend.tip: Self-mill and sacrifice fuel descend - permanent cards include creatures, artifacts, lands, etc.

bargain.name: Bargain
bargain.description: You may sacrifice an artifact, enchantment, or token as you cast this spell for an additional effect.
bargain.example: Cast a bargain spell. Sacrifice a token for the enhanced bargain effect.
bargain.tip: Food tokens and other disposable artifacts are perfect bargain fodder.

role token.name: Role Token
role token.description: An Aura enchantment token that attaches to a creature. Only one Role can be attached to a creature at a time.
role token.example: Attach a Cursed Role to an enemy creature. If you add another Role, the old one falls off.
role token.tip: Roles are Auras that replace each other - use beneficial roles on your creatures.

celebration.name: Celebration
celebration.description: An ability that checks if two or more nonland permanents entered under your control this turn.
celebration.example: You played a creature and an artifact this turn. Celebration is active for bonus effects.
celebration.tip: Cheap permanents and tokens easily trigger celebration.

offspring.name: Offspring
offspring.description: You may pay an additional cost as you cast this spell. If you do, when this creature enters, create a 1/1 token copy of it.
offspring.example: Cast your creature and pay its offspring cost. Get the creature plus a 1/1 token copy.
offspring.tip: Offspring copies have the same abilities - doubling enter-the-battlefield effects.

saddle.name: Saddle
saddle.description: Tap creatures you control with total power N or more: This Mount becomes saddled until end of turn.
saddle.example: Your Saddle 3 Mount: tap creatures totaling 3+ power to saddle it for bonus effects.
saddle.tip: Saddled Mounts often have attack triggers or stat boosts when saddled.

plot.name: Plot
plot.description: You may pay the plot cost and exile this card from your hand. Cast it as a sorcery on a later turn without paying its mana cost.
plot.example: Pay 2 to plot a spell. Next turn, cast it for free during your main phase.
plot.tip: Plot spreads costs across turns and lets you cast expensive spells 'for free'.

spree.name: Spree
spree.description: Choose one or more additional costs. Add their effects to the spell.
spree.example: A spree spell has mode A (pay 1) and mode B (pay 2). Choose both for 3 total - get both effects.
spree.tip: Spree is flexible - pay for exactly the modes you need.

impending.name: Impending
impending.description: If you cast this spell for its impending cost, it enters with time counters and isn't a creature until the counters are removed.
impending.example: Cast for impending cost. It enters as a non-creature with time counters. Remove counters each upkeep until it's a creature.
impending.tip: Impending provides a discount but delays the creature - the enchantment is still useful meanwhile.

eerie.name: Eerie
eerie.description: Whenever an enchantment you control enters and whenever you fully unlock a Room, an ability triggers.
eerie.example: Play an enchantment or unlock a Room. Your eerie abilities all trigger.
eerie.tip: Eerie rewards enchantment-heavy decks and Room cards.

survival.name: Survival
survival.description: At the beginning of your second main phase, if this creature is tapped, an ability triggers.
survival.example: Your survival creature attacked (and tapped). In second main phase, its ability triggers.
survival.tip: Tap your creature by attacking or other means to ensure survival triggers.

manifest dread.name: Manifest Dread
manifest dread.description: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Put the other into your graveyard.
manifest dread.example: Look at top 2 cards. One becomes a face-down 2/2, the other goes to graveyard.
manifest dread.tip: Manifest dread provides card selection and a creature - turn face-down creatures face-up later.

delirium.name: Delirium
delirium.description: An ability that checks if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.
delirium.example: Your graveyard has creature, instant, land, artifact. Four types = delirium active.
delirium.tip: Card types: Creature, Instant, Sorcery, Artifact, Enchantment, Land, Planeswalker. Self-mill helps.

threshold.name: Threshold
threshold.description: An ability that checks if there are seven or more cards in your graveyard.
threshold.example: You have 7 cards in graveyard. Threshold abilities are active.
threshold.tip: Self-mill and fetch lands help reach threshold quickly.

metalcraft.name: Metalcraft
metalcraft.description: An ability that checks if you control three or more artifacts.
metalcraft.example: You control 3 artifacts. Metalcraft abilities are now active.
metalcraft.tip: Artifact tokens and cheap artifacts help maintain metalcraft.

landfall.name: Landfall
landfall.description: Whenever a land enters under your control, an ability triggers.
landfall.example: Play a land. All your landfall abilities trigger.
landfall.tip: Fetch lands trigger landfall twice - once when played, once when finding a land.

ferocious.name: Ferocious
ferocious.description: An ability that checks if you control a creature with power 4 or greater.
ferocious.example: You control a 4/4. Ferocious abilities are active.
ferocious.tip: Keep at least one big creature to maintain ferocious effects.

formidable.name: Formidable
formidable.description: An ability that checks if creatures you control have total power 8 or greater.
formidable.example: Your creatures have total power 8. Formidable abilities are active.
formidable.tip: Multiple small creatures can reach 8 total power as easily as one big creature.

spell mastery.name: Spell Mastery
spell mastery.description: An ability that checks if there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard.
spell mastery.example: You have 2 instants in graveyard. Spell mastery is active for bonus effects.
spell mastery.tip: Cheap instants and cantrips help reach spell mastery quickly.

raid.name: Raid
raid.description: An ability that checks if you attacked with a creature this turn.
raid.example: You attacked with a creature. Cast a raid spell for its bonus effect.
raid.tip: Even a small attacker enables raid - attack before casting raid spells.

morbid.name: Morbid
morbid.description: An ability that checks if a creature died this turn.
morbid.example: A creature died this turn (yours or opponent's). Morbid abilities are active.
morbid.tip: Sacrifice effects reliably enable morbid on your terms.

hellbent.name: Hellbent
hellbent.description: An ability that checks if you have no cards in hand.
hellbent.example: You have zero cards in hand. Hellbent abilities are active.
hellbent.tip: Aggressive decks naturally reach hellbent - empty your hand quickly.

kinship.name: Kinship
kinship.description: At the beginning of your upkeep, look at the top card of your library. If it shares a creature type with this creature, reveal it and trigger an ability.
kinship.example: Your Elf has kinship. Upkeep: top card is another Elf - reveal it and get the bonus.
kinship.tip: Tribal decks maximize kinship by running many shared creature types.

heroic.name: Heroic
heroic.description: Whenever you cast a spell that targets this creature, an ability triggers.
heroic.example: Cast a buff spell targeting your heroic creature. Its heroic ability triggers.
heroic.tip: Cheap targeted spells like combat tricks maximize heroic triggers.

battalion.name: Battalion
battalion.description: Whenever this creature and at least two other creatures attack, an ability triggers.
battalion.example: Attack with 3+ creatures including this one. Battalion triggers.
battalion.tip: Token generation helps maintain the three-creature attack requirement.

bloodrush.name: Bloodrush
bloodrush.description: Discard this card and pay its bloodrush cost to give target attacking creature bonuses until end of turn.
bloodrush.example: Discard a bloodrush creature, pay 1 mana, give an attacker +3/+3 until end of turn.
bloodrush.tip: Bloodrush makes creature cards double as combat tricks.

radiance.name: Radiance
radiance.description: An ability that affects the target and each other permanent/creature that shares a color with it.
radiance.example: Target a red creature with radiance. The effect hits ALL red creatures.
radiance.tip: Radiance can hit many creatures at once in multicolor-heavy games.

imprint.name: Imprint
imprint.description: When this permanent enters or is used, exile a card from a specified zone. The exiled card affects this permanent's abilities.
imprint.example: Your artifact imprints a card when it enters. Its abilities reference the imprinted card.
imprint.tip: Choose carefully what to imprint - it typically can't be changed later.

eminence.name: Eminence
eminence.description: This ability works as long as this creature is in the command zone or on the battlefield.
eminence.example: Your commander has eminence. Its ability works even while in the command zone.
eminence.tip: Eminence provides value before you even cast your commander.

partner with.name: Partner With
partner with.description: When this creature enters, target player may search their library for the named partner card and put it into their hand.
partner with.example: Your 'Partner with X' creature enters. Search for X and put it in your hand.
partner with.tip: Partner with is a tutor built into the creature - you'll find the other half.

friends forever.name: Friends Forever
friends forever.description: You can have two commanders if both have friends forever.
friends forever.example: Choose two friends forever commanders. They both lead your deck together.
friends forever.tip: Friends forever is a variant of partner for specific flavor sets.

choose a background.name: Choose a Background
choose a background.description: You can have a Background as a second commander.
choose a background.example: Your commander has 'Choose a Background.' Pick a Background enchantment as second commander.
choose a background.tip: Backgrounds provide additional color identity and abilities from the command zone.

doctor's companion.name: Doctor's Companion
doctor's companion.description: You can have two commanders if the other one is a Time Lord Doctor.
doctor's companion.example: Your Doctor's companion pairs with a Time Lord Doctor commander.
doctor's companion.tip: Doctor's companion is a themed partner variant for Doctor Who crossovers.

more than meets the eye.name: More Than Meets the Eye
more than meets the eye.description: You may cast this card converted for its alternate cost.
more than meets the eye.example: Cast a Transformer for its converted cost - it enters already transformed.
more than meets the eye.tip: More than meets the eye is the Transformers-themed morph variant.

living metal.name: Living Metal
living metal.description: As long as it's your turn, this Vehicle is also a creature.
living metal.example: Your living metal Vehicle is automatically a creature on your turn - no crewing needed.
living metal.tip: Living metal removes the crew requirement on your turn - it's always ready to attack.
